instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00239 cd32 spill
threads.message:
I replaced the cd32 and now get 20.5v 620ma no display or usb activity then it drops to 540ma. Cpu gets warm.
 Im not familiar with these boards . Where to start?

threads.title: 820-00239 cd32 spill
threads.message:
Any history available?
Do you note any change on the VCORE voltage?

threads.title: 820-00239 cd32 spill
threads.message:
Just spillage around U3200.

L7210/L7220  has 1.08v
PPVCC_S0_CPU has 1.08v

threads.title: 820-00239 cd32 spill
threads.message: VCORE doesn't drop to 0.6V in any moment, or maybe 0.9V?

threads.title: 820-00239 cd32 spill
threads.message: Not that I can see. I had it on the oscope for a bit.

threads.title: 820-00239 cd32 spill
threads.message:
Very likely the board doesn't boot.
You should see some changes on VCORE, when it does.

Try known good BIOS, clean ME.

threads.title: 820-00239 cd32 spill
threads.message: Changes in what way? also do you have a link to known good bios?

threads.title: 820-00239 cd32 spill
threads.message:
I'm not sure on this board, but other boards (00840/875) I saw VCORE changing values, 1.1V-0.9V-0.6V.

I don't have tested BIOS for this board yet...

threads.title: 820-00239 cd32 spill
threads.message: Should I be getting  voltage on L7410/7420/7430 ?. I have tried a couple of different efi files but still same.

threads.title: 820-00239 cd32 spill
threads.message: PPVCCGT_S0_CPU appears only under high graphics load.

threads.title: 820-00239 cd32 spill
threads.message: Any ideas where to go from here?

threads.title: 820-00239 cd32 spill
threads.message: U4900  /fl4900 Im not getting any 16v out here is this only in certain conditions?

threads.title: 820-00239 cd32 spill
threads.message: Try to find a known good BIOS for this model...

threads.title: 820-00239 cd32 spill
threads.message:
I found one that supposedly tested 100% but now the unit draws 550ma then drops to 450ma with the same result ie no usb activity and no external or lcd output.

I dumped the original bios 2 times as I usually do and when I write it back now the unit only draws 120ma. I also noticed that l4901 was missing (From U4900 section) so I replaced it but still the same.

threads.title: 820-00239 cd32 spill
threads.message: So someone else worked on it before?

threads.title: 820-00239 cd32 spill
threads.message:
Possibly but it looks like it was broken off rather than  desoldered. I have gone over the board with the microscope and I cannot see any other issues.

[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ugKI0CJmnJ-xhNDMRrhAatSjJ_uzHFGl/view?usp=sharing[/URL]

Here is the original dump if you could look over it if you get a chance and if you could clean the me region I would appreciate it

threads.title: 820-00239 cd32 spill
threads.message:
ME region issue shouldn't affect image.
Do you get USB activity with this file?

threads.title: 820-00239 cd32 spill
threads.message: No none at all

threads.title: 820-00239 cd32 spill
threads.message: Then try full new BIOS; this one doesn't help cleaning ME region.

threads.title: 820-00239 cd32 spill
threads.message: I have tried a few that poster said were fully tested but with the same issues.There may be some signals missing that Im not aware of.

threads.title: 820-00239 cd32 spill
threads.message:
Seems that liquid spill affected some data lines on the board.
If board stays on, with all voltages present, I can only think about bad communication between some BGA chips.

threads.title: 820-00239 cd32 spill
threads.message: Its a tough one. Im not familiar with this board model. Thanks for your input.
